intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium valpiorae, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, with a rough texture, and its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Hieracium valpiorae is often found in high-altitude environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
